titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 5ra-185rc) I-1) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5ra-7va) I-2) Palm Sunday (fols. 7va-14rc) I-3) Monday (fols. 14rc-36vb), including: Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree for Monday morning (fols. 22vb-26rc) I-4) Tuesday (fols. 36vb-58ra) I-5) Wednesday (fols. 58ra-73ra) I-6) Thursday (fols. 73ra-93vc) I-7) Friday (fols. 94ra-158ra), including: Homily by John [Chrysostom] on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass” (fols. 98ra-101ra); Homily by Jacob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 121rc-128vb); Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 154vc-157va) I-8) Saturday (fols. 158ra-185rc), including: Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 162rc-167ra); Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 183va-185rb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Names of several individuals are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Habtä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 5ra, 15rb), Ḫaylä Maryam (e.g., fols. 34va, 36ra), Gäbrä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 37vc, 38va), ʾabunä Wäldä Krǝstos (e.g., fol. 43vb), Wälättä Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fols. 92vc, 116vb) and Wälättä Kidan (e.g., fols. 97ra, 101rb).

txstates.txstate: The fronth board is broken. Several folios are made of pieces sewn together with parchment strips (e.g., fols. 40, 74, 114, 118). Many leaves are affected by humidity. Holes or tears amended on fols. 29, 32, 159, 181.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather (two separate pieces sewn together along the middle of the spine); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (5 tools were used: triple circle, triple line fillet, interlaced line fillet, wave form, cross hatching).

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – [፬]IV(9; s.l.: 3, stub after stub after 5; 4, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 29r-37v) – ፭V(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 38r-45v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 46r-53v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 54r-61v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 62r-69v) – ፱IX(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 70r-77v) – ፲X(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 78r-85v) – ፲፩XI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 86r-93v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 94r-101v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 102r-109v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 110r-117v) – ፲፭XV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 118r-125v) – ፲፮XVI(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 126r-133v) – ፲፯XVII(8/fols. 134r-141v) – [፲]፰XVIII(8/fols. 142r-149v) – [፲]፱XIX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 150r-157v) – ፳XX(8/fols. 158r-165v) – ፳፩XXI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 166r-173v) – ፳፪XXII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 174r-181v) – ፳፫XXIII(7; s.l.: 7, no stub/fols. 182r-188v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The words እግዚአብሔር፡ and እግዚእ፡ are sometimes written with ligature (e.g., fols. 85ra l.17, 131va l.3.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors. Groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I and on the incipit page of the section for the night hours of Friday (in Text I-7); incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-7; the initial words of each paragraph of “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (in Text I-8); some other words, e.g., nastäbäqwǝʿ ḫabekä, Ǝgziʾo täśähalännä (and abbreviations), yǝbe mätärgwǝm, yǝtärägwǝm. Elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the text dividers.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fols. 89v-90r) ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ (e.g., fols. 89v-90r) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 89v-90r) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 116rc, 132va) አ፡ for አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 43ra, 129ra) እግዚኦ᎓ ተ᎓/እግዚኦ᎓ ተሳ᎓ for እግዚኦ᎓ ተሣሃለነ᎓ (e.g., fols. 31v, 32r) ስቡ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም፡ (esp. fols. 152rc-152vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: On fol. 128vb, the “Homily of Jacob of Serug on Abraham” (in Text I-7) ends with a subscriptio ascribing the translation of the homily, from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz, to Metropolitan ʾabba Sälama (in tenure from 1350; cp. EAE IV, 488-89); besides, the original writing of the work is here attributed to Athanasius (Bishop of Alexandria from 328 to 373; cp. EAE I, 392): ዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፨ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፨ እምአረቢ፡ ለግዕዝ፤ ወይተሉ፡ ዝየ፡ ተጽሕፎ፡ ዘይቤ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ አትናቴዮስ፨ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ … አሜን።. Cp. the note, e.g., in GBI-002, fol. 99rc, in GMS-001, fol. 127rb, and in AQG-004, fol. 104va.

additional.cont: Fols. 185rc-187rb: Sälam-hymns for Mary.
additional.add: Fol. 185rc (below the explicit of the text): ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ማርያም፡  ዘመአዛ፡ አፉኪ፡ እንተ፡ ትጼንዊ፡ በገዳም፡ ወሀቅል፡ …
additional.det: The note, with rubrications, seems to have been written in the same hand as the main text. The same note is in Ms. BQM-005, on fols. 3ra-3vc, 176va-177vb.

extras.extra: - Omitted words or letters written interlineally: e.g., fols. 20vc, 76vc, 78vc, 85rc,150va. - Erasure: e.g., fol. 24rc. - Writing exercises (?) and crude notes in pencils: fols. 3r, 187v, 188rv.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Quire marks are written in the left upper margin of the first fol. of the quires: ፪: fol. 13r; ፫: fol. 21r; ፭: 38r; ፮: fol. 46r; ፯: fol. 54r; ፰: fol. 62r; ፱: fol. 70r; ፲: 78r; ፲፩: fol. 86r; ፲፪: fol. 94r; ፲፫: fol. 102r; ፲፬: fol. 110r; ፲፭: fol. 118r; ፲፮: fol. 126r; ፲፯: fol. 134r; [፲]፰: fol. 142r; [፲]፱: fol. 150r; ፳. fol. 158r; ፳፩: fol. 166r; ፳፪: fol. 174r; ፳፫: fol. 182r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes concerning the text are written (in pen or in ink) in a secondary hand (or hands?) in the bottom margin of some fols: fols. 104v, 112rv, 114r, 119v, 120rv, 129r, 135v, 136rv, 137v, 139r, 144v and 145r. - Cotton thread is inserted at the edge of fol. 31.

frames.frame: Fol. 5r: simple, coloured (red, blue, green) ornamental band with two pendants in the intercoloumn spaces; interlaces.
